member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.ContextProviders.AppInfoProvider
member.summary: Collects information about the currently running application.

remarks.para: The collection is named ApplicationInfo and the collected information is:

item.description: Amount of OS handles that your application have opened.
Total amount used by your process (including OS time like reading from files or sending stuff over a socket).
Amount of time used to execute your code.
Executable used to start the process, including the module name, file name, and module memory details.
Executable file name, without path and file extension.
number of bytes of physical memory mapped to the process context.
Current size of virtual memory used by the process.
Current size of memory used by the process that cannot be shared with other processes (i.e. dedicated memory).
Starting priority for threads created within the associated process.

member.returns: Collection. Items with multiple values are joined using ";;"

member.summary: Converts an object into a context collection

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.SubmitDirectlyQueue
member.summary: Will upload errors directly instead of queuing them.

remarks.para: The benefit is that errors are uploaded in parallel and that exceptions (misconfigured library) are reported to the developer directly. The down side is that reports are lost if something fails.

member.summary: Stored information in the specified folder

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.Storage.IDataStorage
member.summary: Used to store items before they have been sent to the server.

remarks.para: The storage should be considered as a file folder. I.e. you open one storage per folder that you want to store items in. The actual implementation might store things in a DB or a single file.
We use temp storage to be able to keep reports persistent while collecting user information and sending them to our service.
For instance web applications can't store the reports anywhere while getting user feedback (since two different HTTP requests are made)

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.IncludeNonPublicMembersContractResolver
member.summary: JSON.NET class which also includes all private fields.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Welcome to the reporting library for OneTrueError. Read below the class list for more information

remarks.para: This library is configured by using the class. Read it's documentation for an example.

If you are interested in providing your own context information automatically you should start by reading the namespace and then add your own provider by using OneTrue.Configuration.AddContextProvider().
To submit the collected errors you need to configure an . You can use our submitter which uploads all reports to onetrueerror.com, it's named .

You can also submit the error report to your own custom destination (you actually do not have to use our service). A submitter is quite easy to create, just implement the interface and add it using OneTrue.Configuration.AddSubmitter()

example.para: To manually submit a report you have to do the following:

member.summary: Catch console exceptions.

member.summary: Shortens GUIDs using Base64 and convert the result to a URL friendly string.

member.summary: Create a 22-character case-sensitive short GUID.

member.summary: Get a short GUID as a Guid object.
member.exception: Input string was not in a correct format.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.IErrorCallback
member.summary: Can be used to hook into the reporting process.
member.remarks: All callbacks are invoked as soon as a new exception has been reported.

member.summary: Trigger callback

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.ReportIdGenerator
member.summary: Used to be able to choose reportId id strategy

remarks.para: The reportId id is the string which are used during communication between the end customers and the OneTrue error customers.
The default implementation Base64 encodes a guid (the last "--" is removed from the Base64 string,"/" is replaced with "_" and "+" is replaced with "-".
The ID must be globally unique (or at least within your own application scope).

member.summary: Assign a custom ID generator.

member.summary: Generate a new ID
member.param: Exception to get an reportId for

members.member:
Central class which receives all unhandled exceptions
This class will coordinate the work. i.e. first collect data using the that you have configured and then use one of the to get user feedback and finally submit the data using one/more of the
TODO: Fix the docs.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrueErrorHandler.#ctor(OneTrueError.Reporting.ContextProvidersRegistrar)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

members.member:
An exception has been caught.
Context information about the exception Additional custom context collections
The purpose of the context is to allow different exception reporters to provide context information without affecting the base operations.
You can provide your own custom context collections.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.Storage.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: We need to be able to temporarily store information on the local computer. These classes and interfaces are responsible of enabling that.

remarks.para: All adapters of this library do not have the same permissions or access to the same folders. Hence we need some way to allow each adapter to customize where the data is actually stored. Hence this namespace. The actual strategy is set by using .

The need to store is because some adapters (like for ASP.NET) require two different steps before the report is complete. (i.e. redirect to an error page and ask the user for more information. We also need to be able to collect several reports before uploading them to the site (to limit the amount of used bandwidth).

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: Submitters are the classes which takes error reports and delivers them to a specific destination. The destination itself can be anything from an local log file to a web service.

remarks.para: The OneTrueError reporter is defined as .

This library will enqueue every error report for each submitter and also persist the queue. It that way the library can continue to upload error reports to every submitter even if the application crashes.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.ReportToOneTrueError
member.summary: Upload reports to our web site.

remarks.para: To use this reporter you have to create an account at http://onetrueerror.com and then register an application to get an application key and a shared secret.
Finally use that information to configure this reporter:
This reporter will detect if there is no internet connection and wait until there is one and then upload all temporarily stored reports.
This reporter will temporarily store all reports locally and then upload them in a queued manner. In that way no reports are lost if the application crashes.

If your clients are behind a company proxy you'll have to configure your application to use the default proxy with credentials (works even if there is no proxy). Add the configuration below to your app.config (or web.config)
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <system.net> <defaultProxy useDefaultCredentials="true" /> </system.net> </configuration>

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue
member.summary: Configures the framework.
member.remarks: You typically configure the library like below, but then you also have to catch the exceptions. You can either do it manually (and then call ) or by using one of the . Do note that there are several separate integration packages which automatically configures ASP.NET, WCF etc.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue.CreateReport(OneTrueError.Reporting.Reporters.IErrorReporterContext,OneTrueError.Reporting.Contracts.ContextInfo[])
member.summary: Create a new error report
member.param: Context information which can be used when collecting additional information
Custom context information. You can for instance supply the invalid domain entity or view model. Only simple objects are supported (i.e. one level deep)

remarks.para: The report is temporarily stored on the disk until the SendReport() method has been invoked.
All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.Configuration.Advanced.UploadReportFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue.SendReport(System.String)
member.summary: Send the error report to all configured submitters.
member.param: The report id (which was returned from ).

remarks.para: All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.Configuration.Advanced.UploadReportFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue.Report(System.Exception)
member.summary: Report an error directly
member.param: Exception that you want to get reported
member.returns: Unique identifier for this report (generated using )

remarks.para: A lot if context information is also included in the error report. You can configure the attached information by using
All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.Configuration.Advanced.UploadReportFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue.Report(System.Exception,System.Object)
member.summary: Report an exception directly
member.param: Additional context information. Can for instance be an entity or view model.
member.returns: Unique identifier for this report (generated using )

remarks.para: All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.Configuration.Advanced.UploadReportFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue.SendFeedback(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Attach feedback to a error report
member.param: User supplied email address (if user would like to receive status updates for this error). Optional
A description written by the user of what he did when the error happened. Optional

remarks.para: This method can be used to submit feedback after the actual error report have been sent.
All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.Configuration.Advanced.UploadReportFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue.SendReport(System.String,OneTrueError.Reporting.Reporters.UserSuppliedInformation)
member.summary: Send the error report to all configured submitters.
member.param: The report id (which was returned from ).
Additional information supplied by the user like description of what the user did when the error occurred.

remarks.para: All library exceptions are directed to the OneTrue.Configuration.Advanced.UploadReportFailed event. Subscribe on that event if you have trouble with reporting exceptions

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Reporting.OneTrue.Configuration
member.summary: Used to configure on true error. Visit it's documentation for more information about all options.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.SubmitCoordinator
member.summary: Responsible of making sure that all submitters have delivered the reports.

remarks.para: To guarantee that errors are uploaded despite of unhandled exceptions or bad internet connection we'll enqueue all reports and upload them in order. This typically means that we store them on disk as JSON.
The disk location depends on the type of application. For ASP.NET we try to create a folder under App_Data while for other applications we use the roaming profile folder.

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.SubmitCoordinator.#ctor(OneTrueError.Reporting.Storage.IDataStorageFactory)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting un-managed resources.

member.summary: Submit a report (will be enqueued in all registered submitters and uploaded as soon as possible).

member.name: M:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.SubmitCoordinator.Add(OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.IErrorSubmitter)
member.summary: Add an additional submitter

member.name: P:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.SubmitCoordinator.UploadDirectly
member.summary: Reports should be uploaded directly and not queued.

remarks.para: Uploads that fails will result in that reports are thrown away.
This setting MUST be configured before any submitters are added. i.e. before the credentials command.

member.name: T:OneTrueError.Reporting.Submitters.SubmitterQueue
member.summary: Makes sure that all error reports are persisted for every submitter so that that every submitter can upload all reports no matter if the application dies or not.

remarks.para: The queue will automatically try to upload reports again if the application fails.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The submitter that the queue is for.
